app.title: Spotify: Music and Podcasts
app.description:
With the Spotify music and podcast app, you can play millions of songs, albums and original podcasts for free. We have even added audiobooks, so you can enjoy thousands of stories wherever you are!

Stream music and podcasts, listen to audiobooks, discover albums, playlists or even single songs for free on your mobile or tablet. Subscribe to Spotify Premium to download and listen offline wherever you are.

Spotify gives you access to a world of free music, curated playlists, artists, and podcasts you love. Discover podcasts, new music, top songs or listen to your favorite artists and albums.

WHY SPOTIFY FOR MUSIC AND PODCASTS?
• Listen to over 80 million songs and 4 million podcasts (and counting)
• Enjoy over 300,000 newly added audiobook titles
• Discover new music, albums, playlists and original podcasts.
• Search for your favorite song or artist by typing a lyric
• Enjoy amazing sound quality on music and podcasts across all devices.
• Create and share your own music playlists to suit your mood or discover other playlists you might like.
• Listen to daily music mixes made just for you.
• Explore top songs from different genres, countries or decades.
• Subscribe to your favourite podcasts so that you never miss an episode, then curate your very own podcast library.
• Bookmark individual podcasts into Playlists
• Listen to music and podcasts on your mobile, tablet, desktop, PlayStation, Chromecast, TV, Wear OS or wearable device.

Listen and discover the latest music from artists like;
• Bad Bunny
• Billie Eilish
• Renzo Pianciola
• The Temper Trap
• Harry Styles

Listen to your favorite music artists all day every day via the Popular Radio playlist feature. Here are just some of the artists we’ve already curated;
• Taylor Swift
• Drake
• Eminem
• Coldplay
• Paolo Nutini
• Fleetwood Mac

Listen to over 40 category genres - New Releases, Charts, Live Events, Made for You, At Home, Only You, Summer, Pop, Workout, Hip-Hop, Mood, Party, Pride, Dance/Electronic, Alternative, Indie, Equal, Wellness, Rock, Frequency, R&B, Disney,, Throwback, Radar, Chill, Sleep, In the car, Kids & Family, Caribbean, Classical, Romance, Jazz, Instrumental, Afro, Christian and Gospel and Country.

Listen to popular and exclusive podcasts like;
• The Joe Rogan Experience
• Modern Wisdom
• 2 Bears, 1 Cave with Tom Segura and Bert Kreischer
• Call Her Daddy and Crime Junkie

Search, discover and play music, podcasts and audiobooks from all over the world for free, anywhere, anytime or create your own music playlists with the latest songs to suit your mood.

WHY GO PREMIUM?
• Listen to albums and playlists without ad breaks.
• Download and listen to music and podcasts offline, wherever you are.
• Jump back in and listen to your top songs with on-demand playback.
• Choose from 4 subscription options – Individual, Duo, Family, Student. There’s no commitment and you can cancel any time

Audiobooks in Premium currently available in Australia, the UK & the US. Discover 250,000+ titles, 15 hours/month of available listening for Premium Individual subscribers and Duo & Family plan managers.

Experience Spotify on your Wear OS device:
• Enjoy your favourite music and podcasts without having your phone around.
• Control playback on your phone or any of your Spotify compatible devices.
• Download your favourite content for offline listening on the go (Premium only).
• Get instant access to Spotify with our Tiles and Complications.

Please note: This app features Nielsen’s audience measurement software which will allow you to contribute to market research, such as Nielsen’s Audio Measurement. If you don't want to participate, you can opt-out within the app settings. To learn more about our digital audience measurement products and your choices in regard to them, please visit https://www.nielsen.com/digitalprivacy for more information.

app.summary: Listen to songs, play podcasts, create playlists and discover music you'll love

reviews.text: A slight hiccup is happening recently (January 2025... still there March 2025) - every time I open the app and click on any option, it shuts down. I can immediately reopen it and it works fine. But it seems to need to shut down at least once. I believe it's typically when I choose "Your Library", "New Episodes". Have used app for years and love it.

I love using Spotify. However, I wish they would bring the option back to rearrange your Playlist via the mobile app, especially when you're paying for Premium Service. Having to login via the internet or computer is an inconvenience when you're paying for the service monthly you should be able to change the order of the songs via the app. **sigh** :-(

On my device, it's awesome. I use this everyday, everywhere and always, for over 50,000 minutes. Other than the ads (which aren't too annoying once, again, on my device) it's pretty much perfect. I just don't enjoy how some songs are unavailable because of regions, but it's not a big issue since the mainstream is there as well as a lot of underground. There's not much to complain about, since I use the free version. So far, i say this is great.

I've used this app for 13 years, and it's the best music app out of all of them. Highly recommend! Edit: Why did the "search in your library" feature changed. I really enjoyed searching an artist and having all of the songs I like come up instead of making individual playlists of all the artists. Now, it shuffles through my library playlist instead of the searched songs. It's a bummer!

I have the free version right now because I can not afford premium. I will get the ad saying "listen for 30 minutes of ad free music" then it literally plays 1 3-4 minute song before I get another 2 minute set of ads. I habe time stamped screen shots to prove this. At this point, I feel as though im listening to more ads than I am music and highly considering switching streaming services. We're getting to a point where I almost can't listen to music unless I pay. Fix it!
reviews.replyText: Hi there, thanks for your feedback. No worries, we'll pass this along to the Ads team. To get the 30-minute ad-free music, be sure to keep the video ad in focus. Don't navigate to another app, browser, etc. Make sure that you're not accidentally clicking the "No, thanks" button as well, when prompted to watch the ad. Hope this helps.

reviews.text: Can't look up an artist and see their album to add songs to my playlist. I have to look up each song. I also can't pick a song and listen because Spotify will only play a different song. You already get money from making me listen to ads. I'm on a limited income and can't afford to pay a monthly fee. Also, throwing in random songs on my playlist that I didn't add is not welcome. I want to hear my choices. This makes me not want to use Spotify at all. I'll find a better music app.

I usually love Spotify, I even have premium, but recently it has been SO testy when I try to open it. Sometimes it will work fine, but most of the time it just opens to a black screen and no matter if I reset the app, or even my phone, nothing really helps it. When it does this, if it eventually opens, everything is incredibly slow to load. I'm very disappointed.
reviews.replyText: Hi. Have you tried a quick reinstall? If that doesn't help, we'd recommend reaching out to our Customer Service at support.spotify.com. Just search “Contact Us”, and they'll be happy to help.

reviews.text: "30mins of free listening after this ad" Two songs later, I get even more ads. Don't lie to me please. It has potential but you need premium to get the good features. Even with premium, I'm still having trouble with the app. I used offline mode while I travel for work and half the time my playlists won't play. I tried listening to a podcast and I get "playback failed" even though the episode is downloaded to my phone.
reviews.replyText: Hey Michael. We hear you, and we'll pass your feedback along to the Ads team. Also, check out this topic in our Community at community.spotify.com and search for "30 mins of uninterrupted listening".

reviews.text: I have been using Spotify for years and have been a premium member pretty much the whole time. For the price, it's totally worth it. I use it for music in my car, music for cleaning the house, music for sleep, asmr for sleep, podcasts, music for my toddler, or just music for lounging around the house. I was in the top 2% of Spotify users a couple years in a row. Saying I use this app all the time is an understatement. It's really good at creating playlists specifically tailored to me.

Why remove the ability to delete a song from the play queue? I don't understand why I pay for an app that tries to control everything I listen to. Isn't that the whole point of paying? That, plus the fake "shuffle" feature makes me hate Spotify. Again, if it's a playlist I made, I like all of the songs! I don't need Spotify to play 5% of them over and over for me and never play the other 95%. I suppose it's time to find a new music service.

app.recentChanges: We’re always making changes and improvements to Spotify. To make sure you don’t miss a thing, just keep your Updates turned on.
app.AIReview:
Spotify: Music and Podcasts – A Comprehensive Review

Overview

Spotify remains, unequivocally, the dominant player in the music streaming landscape. With over 2.49 billion installs and a robust 4.34 rating based on 33.7 million user reviews, its popularity is undeniable. The app offers a vast library encompassing millions of songs, albums, original podcasts, and recently, audiobooks, catering to nearly every musical taste imaginable. Its free tier provides substantial access, while the Premium subscription unlocks offline listening, higher audio quality, and an ad-free experience. This review delves into the core functionality, usability, and overall value proposition of Spotify, examining its strengths, weaknesses, and how it stacks up against competitors.

Key Features

Spotify’s feature set is built around a familiar, yet refined, streaming interface. Here's a breakdown of the most important elements:

  • Vast Music Library: The app boasts an enormous catalog – estimated to be over 100 million tracks - making it exceptionally easy to find almost any song you can think of.
  • Podcast Integration: Spotify has significantly invested in podcasts, offering a dedicated section with thousands of shows across various genres including news, comedy, true crime, and educational content.
  • Audiobooks: The inclusion of audiobooks represents a strategic expansion, allowing users to consume stories alongside their music and podcast listening habits.
  • Playlist Creation & Management: Users can create custom playlists – public or private – with ease, adding songs from the library or importing them directly from other sources. Collaborative playlists are also supported, enabling shared listening experiences.
  • Discover Weekly & Daily Mixes: Spotify’s algorithm-driven “Discover Weekly” and “Daily Mix” playlists are a key element of user engagement, introducing listeners to new artists and tracks based on their existing preferences.
  • Offline Listening (Premium): Subscribers can download songs and podcasts for offline playback, ideal for travel or areas with limited internet connectivity.
  • Social Sharing: Seamless integration allows users to share music they're listening to, playlists, and individual tracks directly to other social media platforms.
  • Radio Stations: The app offers curated radio stations based on artists, genres, or moods.

Strengths

  • Massive Content Library: The sheer scale of Spotify’s music library is its greatest strength. Finding a song you enjoy is almost guaranteed.
  • Powerful Recommendation Engine: The algorithm driving “Discover Weekly” and other personalized playlists has proven remarkably effective at introducing users to new music they will likely appreciate, fostering long-term engagement.
  • Cross-Platform Compatibility: Spotify operates seamlessly across iOS, Android, desktop (Windows & macOS), smart speakers, and even web browsers, providing a consistent experience regardless of the device used.
  • User-Friendly Interface: The app’s design is generally intuitive and easy to navigate, making it accessible to users of all technical skill levels.
  • Podcast Ecosystem: Spotify has successfully integrated podcasts into its core offering, creating a compelling audio entertainment platform beyond just music.

Areas for Improvement

  • Audio Quality (Free Tier): The free tier’s audio quality is compressed, which can be noticeable to audiophiles and serious music listeners. This remains a significant barrier for converting casual users to Premium subscriptions.
  • Playlist Organization: While playlist creation is straightforward, managing large numbers of playlists can become cumbersome. Improved organizational tools – such as tagging or advanced filtering – would greatly benefit power users.
  • Artist Compensation: The ongoing debate surrounding artist royalties and Spotify's payout rates remains a critical area for improvement. Transparency around these figures could build trust with artists.
  • Search Functionality: While the search bar is functional, it occasionally struggles to surface relevant results, particularly when searching for less popular tracks or artists. Refining the algorithm for more accurate searches would be beneficial.
  • Interface Clutter (Premium): The Premium interface can feel slightly cluttered with options and controls, potentially overwhelming new users. A simplified view option could alleviate this issue.

User Experience

The overall user experience is positive, largely due to Spotify's intuitive design and robust features. Navigation is simple, playback controls are clear, and the app feels responsive across different devices. The "Discover Weekly" playlist, in particular, consistently delivers relevant and engaging recommendations, driving exploration and increasing daily usage. However, as noted previously, the interface could benefit from further streamlining to reduce visual clutter, especially for Premium users who have access to a wider range of features. The onboarding process is well-designed, guiding new users through the app's core functionality without feeling overly intrusive.

Value for Money

Spotify’s pricing structure offers a compelling value proposition:

  • Free Tier: Provides unlimited listening with ads and lower audio quality – suitable for casual listeners.
  • Premium Individual ($9.99/month): Removes ads, offers higher audio quality, and enables offline listening.
  • Premium Duo ($12.99/month): Discounted rate for two users living at the same address.
  • Premium Family ($16.99/month): Provides access to Premium for up to six family members.

Considering the vast library and features available, Spotify's Premium subscriptions represent excellent value, especially compared to competing streaming services.

Conclusion

Spotify continues to be a dominant force in the music streaming industry. Its massive content library, powerful recommendation engine, and cross-platform compatibility contribute significantly to its success. While areas for improvement remain – particularly around audio quality and playlist management – Spotify’s strengths far outweigh its weaknesses. With over two billion installs and consistently high ratings, it's clear that Spotify has successfully cultivated a loyal user base and remains the go-to choice for millions of music lovers worldwide. The addition of audiobooks further solidifies its position as a comprehensive entertainment platform, making it well worth the download – regardless of whether you opt for the free or Premium version.
